title: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025 - SciTechDaily
summary:
NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: SciTechDaily

NASA and ISRO are preparing to launch the NISAR satellite in March 2025. Designed to monitor nearly all of Earth’s land and ice surfaces every 12 days, NISAR will track changes in ecosystems, land, and sea ice, as well as the solid Earth, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in India.

  • NISAR stands for NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar.
  • The satellite will track environmental changes every 12 days.
  • It will provide data on ecosystems, ice masses, and geological processes.
  • Significant partnership between NASA and ISRO showcasing international collaboration.
“By observing these changes at unprecedented resolution, NISAR will play a crucial role in improving environmental management and disaster response.”

The NISAR mission is poised to significantly enhance global understanding of Earth’s changing environments and better inform response strategies to natural disasters.
newTitle: NISAR Satellite Set To Revolutionize Earth Monitoring in 2025

title: NASA’s Parker probe achieves historic feat, flying closer to the Sun than any spacecraft before - Firstpost
summary:
NASA’s Parker Probe Achieves Historic Feat by Flying Closer to the Sun

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: Firstpost

The Parker Solar Probe has made history by flying closer to the Sun than any other spacecraft, scheduled for a flyby on December 24, 2024, at 6:53am EST.

  • The probe is on a seven-year mission to deepen understanding of the Sun and forecast space weather events.
  • The spacecraft reached a distance of 3.8 million miles (6.1 million kilometers) from the Sun.
  • NASA officials describe this achievement as a ‘yay, we did it’ moment.
  • The Parker Solar Probe will be making two more close passes in March and June of 2025.
“Right now, Parker Solar Probe is flying closer to a star than anything has ever been before,” - Nicky Fox, NASA official.

This mission is aimed at answering significant questions about the Sun, including how solar wind originates and why the corona is hotter than the Sun's surface.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Probe Achieves Historic Feat by Flying Closer to the Sun

title: NASA astronauts share special Christmas holiday message from International Space Station - MSN
NASA's Parker Solar Probe attempts historic closest-ever approach to Sun | All you need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Parker Solar Probe made history on Christmas Eve by approaching within 3.8 million miles of the Sun, the closest any spacecraft has ever been, as it journeys into the solar corona to enhance our understanding of the Sun.

  • The probe travels at speeds of up to 430,000 mph.
  • It can withstand temperatures reaching 982°C.
  • This flyby is the first of three planned close approaches, with the next occurring in March and June 2025.
  • The probe aims to uncover the mysteries of solar phenomena, including solar wind origins and the heat of the corona.
“No human-made object has ever passed this close to a star, so Parker will truly be returning data from uncharted territory.” - Nick Pinkine, mission operations manager.

This mission marks a significant milestone in solar exploration, providing invaluable data that could alter our understanding of solar science.
newTitle: NASA's Parker Solar Probe Makes Historic Close Approach to the Sun

title: Top Astronomy Events for 2025 - Universe Today
summary:
Top Astronomy Events for 2025

Catch the best sky watching events coming up in the year 2025, which features rare occurrences and engaging celestial phenomena.

title: Santa Claus: A Symbol of the Global Economy at Work - Forex Factory
summary:
Santa Claus: A Symbol of the Global Economy at Work

Date: Dec 24, 9:52am Source: The Globalist

Father Christmas, Saint Nick, or — as he is better known — Santa Claus, is a symbol of the global economy. After all, he is an exporter — he delivers goods (toys) to consumers (children who are good) across the world.

  • Santa Claus operates with a business model similar to thriving export businesses.
  • He has recognized that the North Pole has a limited domestic market for toys.
  • His delivery system showcases best practices in global trade.
“Santa Claus is a born globalist.”

This article highlights how the figure of Santa Claus embodies the principles of global trade and exchange.

title: NASA’s close encounter with Sun! Parker Solar Probe to make historic flyby of star’s surface on Christmas Eve - The Financial Express
summary:
NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to Make Historic Flyby of the Sun's Surface on Christmas Eve

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NASA

The Parker Solar Probe is set to achieve a historic milestone this Christmas Eve by flying closer to the Sun than any previous human-made object.

  • The spacecraft will pass just 3.8 million miles from the Sun’s surface during its 22nd close approach.
  • Currently the fastest human-made object, moving at 430,000 miles per hour.
  • Aims to explore why the Sun’s corona is significantly hotter than its surface.
  • Equipped with a specialized heat shield to withstand temperatures of around 1,800°F.
  • Data collection will begin shortly after the flyby, with updates provided by NASA.
  • The mission will continue with more flybys planned in the coming years.
“By studying the Sun from such close proximity, the Parker Solar Probe is poised to answer long-standing questions about solar activity.”

This flyby is a landmark achievement in solar exploration and will enhance our understanding of space weather and its impact on Earth.
newTitle: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe to Make Historic Flyby of the Sun's Surface on Christmas Eve

title: Asteroid or comet? Scientists find ancient ice giant in our solar system - The Times of India
summary:
Asteroid or comet? Scientists find ancient ice giant in our solar system

Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Researchers have discovered new insights about Chiron, a centaur located between Jupiter and Neptune, using the James Webb Space Telescope. This object exhibits characteristics of both a comet and an asteroid.

  • Chiron is a unique centaur that displays both surface features and coma, which is a cloud of gas and dust surrounding it.
  • The study found carbon dioxide and carbon monoxide ice on Chiron’s surface and detectable gases such as methane in its coma.
  • Dr. Noemí Pinilla-Alonso highlighted Chiron’s role as a “time capsule” preserving solar system formation information.
  • Future research aims to observe Chiron as it approaches Earth to understand its response to sunlight and temperature changes.
Dr. Noemí Pinilla-Alonso stated, “What is unique about Chiron is that we can observe both the surface and the coma.”

The findings on Chiron could reshape our understanding of centaurs and the solar system’s early history.
newTitle: Asteroid or Comet? New Findings on Chiron, the Ice Giant of Our Solar System

title: Dark energy doesn't exist: Scientists make shocking claim on big mystery - Business Standard
World's most advanced and expensive; Indo-US NISAR satellite to launch soon - Business Standard
summary:
Indo-US NISAR Satellite Set to Launch in March 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The world's most advanced and expensive earth observation satellite, NISAR, developed by India and the US, is expected to launch by March 2025 after several delays.

NISAR, designed for precise monitoring of Earth’s ecosystems, will scan land and ice surfaces, aiding in climate change research and disaster management.

  • NISAR stands for NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar.
  • The satellite will measure changes in ecosystems, sea ice, and geological activity.
  • It features dual-frequency radar for unprecedented data accuracy.
  • Jointly funded by India and the US with a budget of Rs 5,800 crore.
  • Launched from Satish Dhawan Space Centre in India.
“NISAR will help scientists to better understand the hard outer layer of Earth, its crust.”

The NISAR satellite will significantly contribute to environmental monitoring and disaster response by providing reliable data on global changes.
newTitle: Indo-US NISAR Satellite Set to Launch in March 2025

title: Tidal heating of Moon may have resulted in misleading magma mask - News9 LIVE
summary:
Tidal Heating of Moon May Mislead Scientists on Age

Date: December 2024
Source: News 9 Live

Recent research reveals that the Moon's surface reheated post-formation, complicating age estimates. While initial analyses suggest the Moon is around 4.35 billion years old, an alternate lifespan of 4.51 billion years is also proposed due to zircon crystal studies. This reheating was possibly fueled by tidal flexing from Earth's gravity.

  • Analysis indicates the Moon formed from a massive collision 4.35 billion years ago.
  • Surface remelting could mask its true age, leading to altered interpretations of impact craters.
  • Future lunar missions may provide further geological insights.
  • Research coauthor Thorsten Kleine states lunar rock samples inform about the Moon’s turbulent history.
  • Continued research is expected to evolve understanding of the Moon's formation and history.
“The lunar rock samples tell us the Moon’s entire, turbulent history.” – Thorsten Kleine

Future missions are anticipated to clarify the Moon's origins and its importance in the solar system's history.
newTitle: Tidal Heating of Moon May Mislead Scientists on Age

title: Tidal heating on Moon may have resulted in misleading magma mask - News9 LIVE
summary:
Tidal Heating on Moon May Have Misled Scientists About Its Age

Publication Date: New Delhi | Source: News9 Live

The surface of the Moon has reheated after its formation, leading scientists to misinterpret its true age. New research suggests this reheating may have masked evidence of its actual history.

  • The Moon is estimated to be around 4.35 billion years old, formed from a collision with a Mars-sized planet.
  • Zircon crystals on the surface could indicate the Moon's age may reach 4.51 billion years.
  • The heating process might have been driven by tidal flexing from the Earth's gravitational pull.
  • Future lunar missions, such as China's Chang’e-6 and ISRO's Chandrayaan-4, are expected to provide more insights into the Moon's geological history.
Thorsten Kleine, coauthor of the study, states: 'The lunar rock samples tell us the Moon’s entire, turbulent history... The new results mean that all the pieces of the puzzle that previously didn’t fit together now form a coherent overall picture of the Moon’s formation.'

Understanding the Moon's past continues to evolve with ongoing research and explorations.
newTitle: Tidal Heating on Moon May Have Misled Scientists About Its Age

title: Research combines solar astronomy with AI, helping in solar observations - INDIAai
Parker Solar Probe to enter Sun's inner sanctum today to ring in Christmas - India Today
summary:
Parker Solar Probe to Enter Sun's Inner Sanctum Today to Ring in Christmas

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: India Today

Nasa's Parker Solar Probe is set to make history on Christmas Eve with a record-breaking flyby of the Sun, passing within 6.1 million kilometers of the Sun's surface.

  • The probe will travel at a speed of 692,000 kilometers per hour, the fastest ever for a human-made object.
  • This flyby will help scientists study the Sun's corona and its relationship with solar activity.
  • Potential observations may include coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which are significant solar phenomena.
  • Data collected will enhance understanding of solar wind and corona heating.
  • Mission project scientist Nour Rawafi expressed excitement over potential discoveries.
If the Sun produces a massive explosion while Parker Solar Probe is near, that would be remarkable. - Nour Rawafi

After its closest approach, communication with the probe will pause until December 27, 2024, for status updates.
newTitle: Parker Solar Probe to Enter Sun's Inner Sanctum on Christmas Eve

title: 7 longest living deep-sea creatures - DNA India
ISRO and NASA to Launch NISAR Satellite in March 2025 for Earth Observation - Gadgets 360
summary:
NISAR Satellite Launch by ISRO And NASA Set for March 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

American space agency NASA and the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) are scheduled to launch the NISAR satellite in March 2025, aiming to advance Earth observation capabilities globally.

  • The NISAR mission, estimated at Rs. 5,000 crore, seeks to track planetary changes with precision.
  • The satellite weighs 2.8 tonnes and will scan nearly all of Earth's land and ice surfaces every 12 days.
  • It incorporates advanced synthetic aperture radar (SAR) technology for high-resolution images under any weather conditions.
  • The satellite is set to operate for three years from a sun-synchronous orbit at an altitude of 747 km.
  • Mission data will support research in various fields, including ecosystem monitoring and disaster management.
“The mission's data will be instrumental in understanding solid Earth movements and global environmental changes.”

The NISAR satellite represents a significant advancement in Earth monitoring technology, expected to contribute valuable data for scientific research and environmental monitoring.
newTitle: NISAR Satellite Launch by ISRO And NASA Set for March 2025

title: 10 pictures show how Elon Musk's SpaceX changed the game in 2024 - India Today
summary:
10 pictures show how Elon Musk's SpaceX changed the game in 2024

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India Today

In 2024, SpaceX made significant advancements in space technology and operations, showcasing groundbreaking achievements that pushed the boundaries of what's possible in aerospace.

  • Successfully completed four Starship demonstration flights, including an orbital flight.
  • Marked the first successful capture of the Super Heavy booster using mechanical arms at the launch site.
  • Awarded $730 million by the U.S. Space Force for nine national-security missions.
  • Achieved a record with the Falcon-9 booster being reused for the 20th time.
  • Expanded its commercial crew program with more missions to the ISS.
  • Executed the world's first private spacewalk during the Polaris Dawn mission.
  • Conducted over 129 Falcon-9 launches for various missions.
  • Demonstrated the first in-space relight of a Raptor engine during a Starship flight test.
  • Significantly increased global internet connectivity through Starlink satellite launches.
"SpaceX continues to redefine what's achievable in space technology and exploration, setting benchmarks for reusability and operational efficiency."

With these milestones, SpaceX solidified its leadership in the space industry, playing a crucial role in both commercial spaceflight and national security.
newTitle: How SpaceX Revolutionized Space Travel in 2024: 10 Key Highlights

title: Christmas eve asteroid 2024 XN1 to skim past earth safely - News Karnataka
SpaceX Calls off Falcon 9 Launch of Four MicroGEO Satellites at Last Second - Gadgets 360
summary:
SpaceX Scrubs Falcon 9 Launch of MicroGEO Satellites at the Last Moment

Date: December 21, 2023
Source: Gadgets 360

SpaceX's planned launch of four MicroGEO satellites was abruptly canceled just before takeoff. The Falcon 9 rocket had its engines ignited but the mission was halted without an explained reason.

  • The launch was set for midnight EST from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.
  • SpaceX has not yet announced a new launch date after initial thoughts of a December 22 attempt.
  • The satellites are produced by Astranis, intended for various connectivity needs including in-flight services.
  • CEO John Gedmark emphasized the launch's importance for Astranis' satellite portfolio expansion.
“This launch was to demonstrate the capability of deploying multiple satellites simultaneously.” - John Gedmark, CEO of Astranis

Further developments on the new launch schedule are awaited as SpaceX continues a detailed inspection of the rocket.
newTitle: SpaceX Scrubs Falcon 9 Launch of MicroGEO Satellites at the Last Moment

title: NASA's Hubble and Chandra Telescopes discover Tilted Black Hole in Galaxy NGC 5084 - India TV News
8 Most Beautiful Space Pictures Shared By NASA Hubble Space Telescope - Times Now
summary:
8 Most Beautiful Space Pictures Shared By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Times Now

This article showcases eight stunning images captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, each highlighting the beauty and complexity of our universe.

  • NGC 2467: A stellar nursery showcasing brilliant blue stars.
  • Carina Nebula: A close-up of a chaotic region with swirling gas and dust.
  • Trumpler 14: A star cluster holding some of the brightest and hottest stars in the Milky Way.
  • Meathook Galaxy: Focus on a compact spiral arm known for a notable supernova.
  • Westerlund 2: Reveals young stars in their formative gas cocoons.
  • Gum 29: Highlights an active stellar nursery.
  • NGC 3324: Positioned in the Carina Nebula, near the volatile star Eta Carinae.
  • Celestial Geode: A gas cavity sculpted by stellar winds from a hot star.
"Hubble’s unique perspective unveils this cosmic marvel in extraordinary detail." - Sparsh Sharma

The imagery captured by Hubble emphasizes not only the breathtaking beauty of space but also the complex processes of stellar birth and evolution.
newTitle: 8 Most Beautiful Space Pictures Shared By NASA Hubble Space Telescope

title: NASA’s Dawn Mission Unveils Insights into Vesta’s Mysterious Gullies Using Lab Simulations - Passionategeekz
NASA's Dawn Mission Unveils Insights into Vesta’s Mysterious Gullies Using Lab Simulations - Gadgets 360
summary:
NASA Simulates Conditions on Vesta to Uncover the Mystery of Its Gullies

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Gadgets 360

The Dawn spacecraft's observations of the asteroid Vesta have led to studies on the origins of its mysterious gullies. Researchers believe that brief liquid flows, potentially from briny water, may explain these features.

  • Nasa's Dawn spacecraft orbited Vesta in 2012, capturing intriguing images of its surface.
  • The recent study published in the Planetary Science Journal utilized experiments to simulate Vesta's conditions.
  • Lab experiments indicate that salty liquids can remain fluid longer in vacuum conditions compared to pure water.
  • Impacts might expose subsurface brine, allowing it to flow and form surface features before freezing.
  • Findings may have broader implications for understanding geological activity on similar airless worlds.
“Briny solutions could remain liquid for up to an hour, sufficient to create the observed gullies.” - Michael J. Poston

The research offers potential insights not only into Vesta but also into other celestial bodies, expanding our understanding of geological processes in space.
newTitle: NASA Simulates Conditions on Vesta to Uncover the Mystery of Its Gullies

title: A new revelation of dark energy being non existent can possibly solve the biggest mystery of the universe - The Times of India
summary:
Scientists Claim Dark Energy May Not Exist, Offering Solutions to Cosmic Mysteries

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Times of India

Recent research suggests that dark energy, a force thought to be responsible for the accelerated expansion of the universe, may not exist. This revelation could provide answers to long-standing astronomical questions.

  • Dark energy has been a key component in cosmological models, influencing theories on the universe's fate.
  • Scientists propose alternative theories to explain observations previously attributed to dark energy.
  • The implications of this research could reshape our understanding of the universe and its structure.
"This breakthrough could fundamentally change our approach to cosmology and the fundamental laws of physics." - Lead Researcher

The findings, if validated, may alter how physicists and cosmologists interpret cosmic phenomena, sparking further investigation into the universe's expansion and composition.
newTitle: Scientists Claim Dark Energy May Not Exist, Offering Solutions to Cosmic Mysteries

title: Astronomers find the smallest main-belt asteroids ever detected: Study - Kalinga TV
Survey of small objects beyond Neptune sheds light on infancy of Solar System - News9 LIVE
summary:
Survey of Small Objects Beyond Neptune Sheds Light on Infancy of Solar System

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: News9 Live

The Webb Space Telescope has revealed three distinct populations of Trans Neptunian Objects (TNOs), providing insights into the raw materials from which the outer planets were formed.

  • The study indicates that TNOs are time capsules, preserving clues about the early Solar System.
  • Some TNOs have transformed into Centaurs, which behave like comets and may develop tails when near the Sun.
  • The James Webb Space Telescope has provided exquisite sensitivity, allowing scientists to study the compositions of TNOs.
  • Research has identified specific molecules in TNOs that explain their diverse spectral features.
  • A paper detailing these findings was published in Nature Astronomy.
“With this new research, a more-complete picture of the diversity is presented and the pieces of the puzzle are starting to come together.” - Noemí Pinilla-Alonso, Lead Author

This research marks a significant step forward in understanding the composition and evolution of celestial bodies in the outer Solar System, potentially shaping future studies in planetary science.
newTitle: Survey of Small Objects Beyond Neptune Sheds Light on Infancy of Solar System

title: NASA Warns Of Airplane-Sized Asteroid Set For Close Encounter With Earth This Week: Date, Time, Speed, Distanc - Times Now
summary:
NASA Warns Of Airplane-Sized Asteroid Set For Close Encounter With Earth This Week

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Times Now

This week, NASA has detected a 95-foot asteroid, known as 2024 YH, which is on a trajectory that will bring it close to Earth at a safe distance of approximately 3,660,000 kilometers.

  • The asteroid will travel at a speed of 37,516 km/h.
  • Its closest approach to Earth is scheduled for 7:04 PM IST on December 26, 2024.
  • 2024 YH is not classified as a Potentially Hazardous Asteroid (PHA).
  • NASA continuously monitors near-Earth objects to assess potential risks.
“Circle December 26 on your calendars, as 2024 YH is going to be yet another celestial event to demonstrate how dynamic our universe really is.”

This close encounter presents no threat, but highlights the importance of tracking asteroid movements for Earth's safety.
newTitle: NASA Warns Of Airplane-Sized Asteroid Set For Close Encounter With Earth This Week

title: Asteroid alert: Massive asteroid to fly past Earth on christmas eve - News9 LIVE
summary:
Asteroid Alert: Massive Asteroid to Fly Past Earth on Christmas Eve

Date: Today | Source: Science News

Asteroid 2024 XN1, an Amor-type near-Earth object, will approach the Earth on Christmas Eve, flying at a distance of about 7.2 million kilometers. It offers a beautiful cosmic show rather than any imminent threat.

  • The asteroid was first observed in late November 2024.
  • Its trajectory suggests an orbital cycle of 2.34 years.
  • This asteroid is relatively small, ranging from 30 to 70 meters across.
  • Amateur astronomers may get a chance to observe it in clear skies on Christmas Eve.
  • Tracking such asteroids helps improve future asteroid encounter predictions and prevention technologies.
“... the Universe presents them with a spectacle of a visitor from space who is as ephemeral as the lights themselves.”

This event serves as a reminder of the importance of space missions and our ongoing need to monitor potential asteroid threats.
newTitle: Asteroid Alert: Massive Asteroid to Fly Past Earth on Christmas Eve
